title: Emitter/runtime: remove prototype null-as-any seeding
description: Stop emitting prototype field seeding via null-as-any (example: Foo.prototype.x = null as any) and other user-module casts. Replace with a runtime helper (e.g. Register.seedFields / Object.defineProperty) or an alternative reflection strategy so output stays typed but Genes reflection continues to work.

title: React HXX: type-safe TSX-like authoring in Haxe
description:
Add a React authoring DSL using an HXX-style macro so users can write TSX-like markup in Haxe and compile it with genes-ts.

Deliverables:
- `genes.react.JSX.jsx` (macro) that parses JSX-ish markup and generates React element expressions
- Output modes:
  - Default: emit `.tsx` and print TSX markup for React element expressions
  - Low-level: emit `.ts` and keep `React.createElement(...)` calls
- JSX runtime:
  - Default: TypeScript `jsx: "react-jsx"` (automatic runtime)
  - Opt-in classic runtime support
- Intrinsic elements are **always typed** (no Dynamic fallback), including `data-*` / `aria-*`
- Optional inline markup support (rewrite `@:markup` -> `JSX.jsx(...)`)
- Tests that compile under strict genes-ts harness and run with `react-dom/server`

Reference pattern: reflaxe.elixir HXX + InlineMarkup.
acceptance_criteria:
- React authoring macro: genes.react.JSX.jsx
- Optional inline markup rewrite: genes.react.InlineMarkup.enable() (gated by -D genes.react.inline_markup)
- TSX mode: emit .tsx + print TSX markup from JSX markers (default automatic runtime)
- Low-level mode: emit .ts + lower JSX markers into React.createElement calls
- Opt-in classic runtime: -D genes.ts.jsx_classic injects React import for TSX output
- Intrinsic elements typed per-tag incl. data-*/aria-*
- Tests: npm run test:genes-ts:tsx (strict + runtime via react-dom/server)
